subject: More On the Calendars
event: Les Dabel writes: "I am on it right now. It looks like within 7 to 10 business days all this should be cleared up. I am also waiting for the extra copies from Quebecor so I can send to you to sign. The packages for these 250 copies have already been put together. So once we receive them from you we will send them right out." And once I receive them, I will announce it here. In another email, Les says: "The worst problem we've had is the international orders. Because the packages were under 1 pound we were told that we did not need custom forms filled out with the packages. Well they were incorrect even though the packages were under 1 pound they were slightly larger than a package that did not require a customs form. I've received pretty much everyone of the international orders back. I've been resending them out with the custom forms. I was doing a great job responding to people emailing us about their calendars up until last week when I pulled a back muscle from carrying boxes and was out for pretty much the whole week. This weekend I've been emailing the customers and updating them and making sure replacements are being sent." Anyway... I am hopeful that we are on our way to getting the problems fixed, and that within a couple of weeks (perhaps longer for the overseas orders) everyone who paid for a calendar will have one. (That's February, by the way. Jon Snow was January).

comments.article:
I absolutely love Komarck's rendition of Tyrion in the sky cell. The tilt of it, the vertigo-inducing drop... very cool.

David and Dan, if you're glancing along at George's Not a Blog: hire Michael Komarck for art design!

Good to know the situation is getting sorted.

That picture is amazing. Kormack is The Man :-)
Well I'll believe it when I get it.  They told me for my overdue poster, the problem was that they used the wrong mailing forms.  So, I'm going to remain skeptical here.

It's such a pity. Those fine pictures and such an incompetent publisher, making mistakes one after another :(
Not that i don't believe they did their best... but if that IS their best it's truly sad. (remember: most people pre-ordered in last fall and were told posting the stuff would commence in November. Now it's february and...)

So... I'm coming to the party somewhat late.  Any chance of my adding myself to the long list of people with unfulfilled orders?  Where would I go and how would I go about signing up to be horribly cheated?  Despite my heavy use of irony, I'm quite serious.  Call me a gambler, but I want me one'a them calendarmajigs.
comments.subject: Glutton for punishment.

comments.article:
If you are indeed serious, the DBPro store is at:

http://www.dabelbrothersstore.com/

Good luck.
comments.subject: Re: Glutton for punishment.

comments.article:
I'm suprised there weren't additional delays from Quebecor. After their bankruptcy and restructuring a little over a year ago, they began a trend of not paying the Truckers hauling their printed materials for upwards of 60 days after delivery. Hopefully everything is on the mend now and DBPro will have learned a few things to avoid for next years calender.

On another note, Febuary is beautiful and creepy at the same time. Very much how I saw the skycell in my mind.
What a wonderful picture!  I am so glad I ordered the calendar and that I will have my signed copy soon!!  Yay!
comments.subject: Wow

comments.article: Sounds great.  I'll keep my eye out for Amazon to get some in stock.

George, thank you for stepping up and doing your best to help out your fans. My calendar finally arrived about a month and a half after the scheduled delivery date. Luckily I never planned on using the calendar I just wanted it for the art so not getting it right away didn't bother me much.

I don't buy the claim that they were doing a "great job" getting back to people who had e-mailed them. Ignoring three e-mails over the course of a few weeks and finally responding to the fourth is not what I would call a great job.

That all being said the calendar is simply stunning, it is a great product and worth the price and wait. If DB would have only sent out an e-mail to us letting us know they have the orders and are running behind it would have turned this poor experience into maybe not a good one but at least an ok one. I highly doubt I will ever purchase anything from DB again due to this experience.

I couldn't help but laugh at Les's claim to have been "doing a great job responding to people emailing us about their calendars up until last week" considering I e-mailed him 3 times at the beginning of January and didn't get a response until I posted on the westeros board.

Also: "This weekend I've been emailing the customers and updating them and making sure replacements are being sent" seems untrue since I wasn't updated. I haven't heard a thing from anyone at Dabel since two and a half weeks ago when Les claimed to have shipped my calendar. It never arrived. If mine was one of the ones with a paperwork mixup, why wasn't I given an update? Why wasn't I given an update when the calendars were going to be late? Why do I have to keep seeing people saying how beautiful the calendar is when they ordered recently and I paid way back in August?

I really appreciate you stepping in and trying to help, and I truly hope you will try to find someone else to produce the aSoIaF calendars once the contract expires. Trying to get a response from a brick wall is exhausting. It also doesn't help that I believe almost nothing they say anymore. It seems they have an endless supply of excuses as to why they should keep my money and give me nothing in return.

Beautiful painting.

It's funny, though. I always imagined the floor of the sky cell ending before the walls. Like say about three feet before. That way the room felt smaller than it alreay was...
Given that Tyrion is my favourite character of all time and this picture is amazing I now have deep cravings for this calendar!!

So I have to write in defense of Les. Everyday I work with the post office to send out bulk mail and despite doing the same exact thing every week, I constantly have packages come back. They randomly enforce rules, make up new rules and just try to make me miserable. I would not be surprised if they took all the calenders, lit them on fire and then sent you a bill. You can't believe anything they tell you, because each teller decides what rules they feel like following and they won't tell you the rules in the first place. I didn't order a calendar, but now I want to just to give support to yet another person burned by the post office.
comments.subject: Bulk Mail

comments.article:
I'm so glad that you posted about many people not receiving the calendars or getting replies to emails. I too have not received my Limited Variant cover of the Fire and Ice Calendar. I have emailed several times over the last couple months with no response. And I am not International but good old Washington state. When you have the time if you could forward my plea for the calendar, I would greatly appreciate it.

Also, that WAS an awesome Superbowl! That's what a Superbowl should be, nail-biting until the end. And I had the biggest crush on Joe Namath when I was a kid. It was great to see him. Still looks good!

Thanks for the wonderful writing. You are an incredible author.

Sincerely,

Kristie Bridgham
comments.subject: Haven't received calendar yet

comments.article: Is there any way I can get a calendar? I didn't pre-order one. Didn't even know about it until I heard about the problems. But I'd love to buy one if it is possible.
My advice: wait till amazon has it in stock. At least they charge the money after (!) shipping an not months before without delivery ... ;-(

comments.upictitle: in search of a clever byline: ETC - Vonnegut
comments.article: Thank you, George.
that is a good photo, hope you release all the remaining photos too.....

Somebody buy Les a laptop so he can do email while laid up in bed :D

I know how the back thing goes. When you have to lay a certain way with this thingy up under the back and an ice pack here... ugh. Glad things are being resolved!
Awesome news about the back being rehabilitated.  Perhaps it may even be strong enough for a (a-hem, cough)strong enough for a DANCE ???

A while back after hearing from Les, I kinda backed the Dabel Brothers again, but now after reading of all these complaints that are still happening it's hard not to be supportive of DB anymore. Problems happen, but DB seems to always be three steps behind each problem and doesn' react until way after the problem arose. Les, if you're gonna be out for a week with a back problem, be proactive. Most business' have this out of office assistant with email so if you know you're gonna be out you can turn that on and every person who emails you will know that you're out of the office!

Also blaming these shipping issues on the post office is no good excuse either. Yeah, some of thes shipping problems may be a result of that, but if you keep having problems with the post office, start using Fedex or UPS. I use those in my job and they are very good at getting packages shipped and delivered on time.

Lastly, George is right, SEND THE F'ing CALENDARS TO BE SIGNED! The people who ordered these were your first customers and paid the most for the calendars. Make them happy! I recieved an unsigned copy of the exclusive cover(which is very beautiful and well made), so I know those have been made, what's the hold up? How hard is it to send over 250 to George to have them signed??

PS- February's is definitely one of the best ones in the calendar. Probably May's after that in my opinion. The picture of Dany in flames is awsome!
comments.subject: Poor Service

comments.article: Hi. I live in Italy and I've preordered my variant cover edition (signed edition was sold out) in August. I've heard nothing from Dabel since then (five months!). Thank you very much mr. Martin for letting me know that my calendar isn't lost and my money were well-spent. I hope I'll receive my copy before the end of the year: I want to see MY calendar as soon as possible!
comments.subject: Great news!

comments.article:
"... even though the packages were under 1 pound they were slightly larger than a package that did not require a customs form"

Speaking as a customs broker for shipments coming into Canada, I'm not surprised he got most of them returned. Since the contents of the packages are items that were purchased, the size of the package has no bearing whatsover.

See, if a business mails someone a letter in a legal sized envelope, customs will just assume there is nothing in there being sold. It's just mail.

But, if there WAS something in there being sold, say tickets to a rock concert, or a CALENDAR and the business didn't declare them as a sale and provide the true value on USPS's infamous "green customs sticker" and stuck it to the outside of the envelope, it would technically be considered fraud.

Ebay sellers shipping internationally get around this all the time by using their personal name in the shipping info instead of the name of their business (if they are a business, anyway) and calling the contents a gift. That's fraud too, but it tends to get overlooked since it usually is a person to person transaction.

But if there is a business's name on the shipper address, the scrutiny at the border goes up a few notches. All the more so if the package is not a normal sized envelope, or if it's bubble wrapped, or whatever.

It sounds like he was trying to sneak these through without the receiver having to pay taxes or duties on the goods. Calendars, btw, are duty free in Canada, so just the tax would have to be paid, GST and PST.

International harmonized tarrif code for calendars? 4910.00
comments.subject: sketchy customs procedures

comments.article:
I think it's pretty clear that this whole calendar thing has been a major snafu, but I've got to say I'm willing to give the Dabel Bros. the benefit of the doubt.

They have consistently put out high quality products, and the bulk of them have been on time. As a comic book store owner, I've had a lot of exposure to their products over the past few years.

The only customer service issues I've ever heard of them having have been for the ASIOAF posters and, now, these calendars.

A possible defense for them - the calendar I ordered for myself at home came in late. The copies I ordered through Diamond Comics (my store's distributor) all came in on time. That said, if the postal service screws you over, find another shipping company; the post office might be cheaper in the short run, but losing your customers will kill your business.

Hey George! Thanks for sticking up for your fans! I created this livejournal account for the sole purpose of posting here about the calendar. I have sent an email to you a while ago at some AOL address but I am not sure if it is the right one. Would you mind posting your current email address?

I agree with the posters above, in that I will not believe anything Les dabel says until the calendar arrives. It's 3 months overdue, and he's given me a shitload of excuses. My advice is that he should not charge customers unless he is ACTUALLY planning to ship the product. If I do not receive my calendar by mid-year I am going to ask Les for a refund as well as a free calendar for wasting my time and making interest revenue off my payment. George, if you have time I recommend you go over to Les Dabel forums and take a look for yourself at just how many angry and unfulfilled customers there are. I seriously recommend you to consider terminating this 3 year contract. Angry fans for 3 years straight is not a pleasant experience for anyone.

Thanks for your time!
comments.subject: les dabel service sucks

comments.article:
Regarding Les's "customs form" thing:
Last week I received (sending back and forth emails with Les) another email explaining to me the customs issue. He promised that he had "already shipped it" (the 4th time he's said this to me), and that I should get it in the mail "early" this week. Well its basically Thursday so there's another broken promise. If you want proof, I would be more than happy to forward to you the huge chain of Excuse Emails that Les has sent me.
comments.subject: by the way

comments.article: At least you're a lucky one, you get replies. I haven't heard anything yet, and I can only hope, that means that DB don't waste any time on writing emails but spend all on shipping those calendars ...
comments.subject: Re: by the way
